TopicTitle: When did you buy KSP? (I want to know how many people waited for it to come out of Early Access)

Articles.Content:
I meant to ask this before the big release date, but I was busy last weekend.

So yeah, I'm curious to know the ratio of people who actually held out all this time to get the game. Or if (for whatever reason) there are people who still haven't bought it. People who browse the forums and are members of the community, despite not playing the game. So... yeah, if you fit that criteria, share your stories.
I bought it in Dec 2013.
don't know the exact dates, but I got the demo when .14 was out, and bought it at .16
If I recall, backin .24 while installing some mods, I saw my folder said last edited Nov. 2013, I'm going to assume that's when I bought it

Oh, sometime in... 2013? I think?

Huh, I don't really remember. I know I bought it over winter break, and that it was the next October when I joined the forum.

So I think in December 2012.

Wow, that was a long time ago.

June 2013, right after .20.2 came out. 

I didn't even know the game was early access until I actually dug into it a bit more. I didn't know a thing about mods or the community. My first launch failed because I went for a realistic gravity turn in the souposphere. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I just \*had\* to get it though. A coworker showed it to me and I couldn't even wait for the Steam summer sale to hit.
I tried the demo in October-ish 13. Bought the game a few days later. That was back in .23, I think?
got mine back when demo was .12 i think 2012 ? not sure long ago tho
Bought it when it was in 0.18 I think. When was that?
August 15, 2013.

According to my Kerbal store acct, 2011-08-12.

I bought it just after the Nasa pack.. so .23.something or so
I bought it the moment they allowed me to, and bought a second copy when the Steam version became available.
0.20, the last chance to see the ol' KSC. Worth it!

You'll probably find that the forum is pretty biased population-wise towards people who bought the game before 1.0 came out at this point. Myself, I made my purchase pretty much as soon as I heard that the price would be going up to $10 for the next version and would keep rising after. Still the best $7 I've ever spent on any game.

Somebody mentioned it to me. Played someones else's. Bought in at .16 shortly after. Bought it again on Steam when that happened for reasons. Missed most of the career mode implementation when my computer died around .21. Got back in at .25 after buying it for a third time on a new Steam account(other one is lost in the realm of forgotten email and log in passwords.).
I believe I bought it at .19

I don't remember the date but the version was 0.23.5... although a played the demo for quite a while, so I might have missed one or even two versions, for all I know!

Wait buildings are destroyable? Crap better take extra care with the stuff I dump off then???

> 
> Wait buildings are destroyable? Crap better take extra care with the stuff I dump off then???

 They can take a LOT of abuse, generally speaking, before they blow up. But yes, it is a good idea to angle your vessels slightly away from the launchpad right away at launch. Particularly in the new version since aerodynamics have taken on a more realistic model and gravity turns are thus much more gradual when done properly now.
